subject: AI & Agents
title: Retrieval and Ranking: Two-Stage Architecture
description: A short lesson to help you apply Retrieval and Ranking: Two-Stage Architecture.

hook.text: YouTube has 800 million videos. You can't score all of them for every user request.

buildup.text: Stage 1 (retrieval): fast, cheap models narrow millions of items down to hundreds.

discovery.text: Stage 2 (ranking): expensive, precise models score the hundreds and pick the top 10.

twist.text: A great ranker is useless if the retriever filtered out the best items before ranking.

climax.text: Optimize both stages independently. Measure retrieval recall and ranking precision separately.

quiz.question: Why use a two-stage retrieval and ranking system?
options: Scoring all items is too expensive; filter first, then rank the subset
